turn up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to turn a switch on a machine such as an oven, radio etc so that it produces more heat, sound etc
turn up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to be found, especially by chance, after having been lost or searched for
turn up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Eventually my watch turned up in a coat pocket.
turn up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to arrive at a place, especially in a way that is unexpected
turn up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: You can’t just turn up and expect a meal.
Steve turned up late, as usual.
turn up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if an opportunity or situation turns up, it happens, especially when you are not expecting it
turn up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Don’t worry, I’m sure a job will turn up soon.
turn up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to find something by searching for it thoroughly
turn up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The police investigation hasn’t turned up any new evidence.
turn up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to shorten a skirt, trousers etc by folding up the bottom and sewing it
turn up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the bottom of a trouser leg that is folded up for decoration or to make it shorter
